skill.name: Error Resolver
skill.description: Systematic error diagnosis and resolution using first-principle analysis. Use when encountering any error message, stack trace, or unexpected behavior. Supports replay functionality to record and reuse solutions.
skill.summary: Systematic error diagnosis and resolution using first-principle analysis. Use when encountering any ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based skill containing only markdown files with error resolution guidance. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls. All bash commands shown are inline documentation examples for debugging reference.

content.value_statement: Debugging errors wastes hours of developer time. This skill provides a systematic 5-step framework to classify, parse, match, analyze, and resolve any error across multiple languages. Includes language-specific pattern libraries and a replay system to record solutions for future reference.
actual_capabilities: Classify errors by type: syntax, type, reference, runtime, network, permission, dependency, config, database, memory
Parse stack traces across JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, Rust to identify error location
Match errors against known patterns for Node.js, Python, React, Go, Rust, Docker, Git, databases
Apply 5 Whys root cause analysis technique to find underlying issues
Record successful solutions in replay system for future reference
Generate debug commands for environment inspection and diagnostics
limitations: Cannot directly execute commands or modify files without explicit user authorization
Cannot access external debugging tools or runtime environments
Cannot reproduce errors in isolated environments without user setup
Cannot integrate with IDEs or debugging platforms directly

use_cases.title: Multi-language debugging
use_cases.description: Resolve errors across JavaScript, Python, Go, React, and database systems using pattern matching

use_cases.title: Container and deployment errors
use_cases.description: Debug Docker, network, and deployment failures with systematic analysis methods

use_cases.title: Learn debugging fundamentals
use_cases.description: Follow structured methodology to understand error messages and find solutions faster

prompt_templates.title: Basic error query
prompt_templates.prompt: I encountered this error: [paste error message]. Please classify it, identify the root cause, and provide a solution with code examples.

prompt_templates.title: Stack trace analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: When you see a stack trace
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse this stack trace and tell me: 1) Where the error originated, 2) Which line in my code caused it, 3) What the error means, 4) How to fix it.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern matching
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a language-specific error
prompt_templates.prompt: This is a [language] error: [error message]. Match it against known patterns and provide the recommended solution.

prompt_templates.title: Root cause deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the 5 Whys technique to this error: [error description]. Trace back to find the underlying root cause and suggest how to prevent recurrence.

output_examples.input: TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined
output: Root Cause: Object accessed before being initialized or API returned null
Fix: Add optional chaining (?.) and null checks before access
Prevention: Use TypeScript interfaces, validate API responses, add defensive coding

best_practices: Always provide the full error message and stack trace when asking for help
Include the context: what you were trying to do when the error occurred
Share relevant code snippets around where the error happened
Use the replay system to document solutions for team knowledge sharing
anti_patterns: Ignoring error messages and making random code changes
Fixing symptoms without finding the rootads to recurring cause (le bugs)
Not verifying that the fix actually resolves the underlying issue
Skipping documentation of solved errors (loses learning opportunity)

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Node.js, Python, React, Go, Rust, Java, Docker, Git, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, and general network/API errors.

faq.question: What is the 5-step error resolution process?
faq.answer: Classify (identify type), Parse (extract key info), Match (find known patterns), Analyze (find root cause), Resolve (apply fix and prevent recurrence).

faq.question: How does the replay system work?
faq.answer: Record successful error solutions as YAML files in .claude/error-solutions/ directory. Future similar errors can be matched against recorded solutions for faster resolution.

faq.question: Is my code safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance and examples. It cannot execute code or access files without explicit user authorization for each action.

faq.question: Why is my stack trace hard to read?
faq.answer: Minified code, anonymous functions, or async operations can obscure traces. Use source maps, name functions, and enable async stack traces in Node.js 12+.

faq.question: How is this different from AI coding assistants?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured debugging methodology and language-specific pattern libraries. It complements coding assistants by focusing specifically on error diagnosis and resolution techniques.
